intro: Iberis amara var. latifolia, commonly known as broadleaf bittercress, is a perennial flowering plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It features basal leaves that are broad and elliptic, with a slightly hairy surface. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, typically blooming in early spring. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland edges or along stream banks. This species is noted for its peppery taste and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
